Markdown Showcase
posts.content:
# Markdown Showcase

This post demonstrates the various markdown features supported by JSON Blog. Let's explore how different elements render.

## Text Formatting

You can make text **bold**, *italic*, or ***both***. You can also ~~strike through~~ text.

## Code Examples

Here's a JavaScript code block showing how to create a blog post:

```javascript
const createBlogPost = ({ title, content, date }) => {
  return {
    title,
    content,
    createdAt: date.toISOString(),
    slug: title.toLowerCase().replace(/\s+/g, '-')
  };
};

const post = createBlogPost({
  title: 'Hello World',
  content: 'My first post!',
  date: new Date()
});
```

And some inline code: `npm install jsonblog-cli`

pages.title: About
pages.content:
# About JSON Blog

JSON Blog is a modern static blog generator that uses JSON for content management and supports full markdown capabilities.

## Features

- Simple JSON-based content management
- Full markdown support
- Fast build times
- Clean, minimalist design
- TypeScript support

pages.title: Getting Started
pages.content:
# Getting Started

## Installation

```bash
npm install jsonblog-cli
```

## Create Your First Blog

1. Create a blog.json file
2. Add your content
3. Run `jsonblog build blog.json`

For more detailed instructions, visit our [GitHub repository](https://github.com/jsonblog/jsonblog-cli).
